Definition.WordDefinition: ruthenium Symbol: Ru Atomic number: 44 Atomic weight: 101.07 Hard white metallic transition element. Found with platinum, used as a catalyst in some platinum alloys. Dissolves in fused alkalis, and is not attacked by acids. Reacts with halogens and oxygen at high temperatures. Isolated in 1844 by K.K. Klaus.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ruthenium \Ru*the"ni*um\, n. [NL. So named from the Ruthenians, a Little Russian people, as coming from Russia, the metal having been found in the Ural mountains.] (Chem.) A rare element of the light platinum group, found associated with platinum ores, and isolated as a hard, brittle steel-gray metal which is very infusible. Symbol Ru. Atomic weight 103.5. Specific gravity 12.26. See {Platinum metals}, under {Platinum}. [1913 Webster]
ruthenium n : a rare polyvalent metallic element of the platinum group; it is found associated with platinum [syn: {Ru}, {atomic number 44}]
